> I agree.  But if you write code (1) to remind you to write 
> code (2), what happens if you make a mistake writing the code 
> (1) (error in the date...).

Well, the simple answer to that is that I don't.

More accurately, the TODO reminder is generated for me by a tool. Naturally,
the tool has got tests. About the only thing that can go wrong is that I
forget to run it.

Robert.
subject: RE: [junit] Re: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts
